Literature Review: The study of language has long been a cornerstone of various disciplines, including linguistics, anthropology, sociology, and communication studies. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the epistemological and methodological frameworks in the study of language across disciplines, highlighting emerging transdisciplinary trends and pressing research needs. We will examine the organizational structure of language departments, degree programs, organizations, and professions, and illustrate the complexity and relevance of the study of language through lexical and morphological investigations.
